title: Q1 Checkpoint: Foundations, Angles & Triangles
description: Cumulative quarterly assessment covering Units 1-2: geometric foundations, angle relationships, parallel lines with transversals, triangle classification, angle sum theorem, exterior angle theorem, and triangle inequality.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Undefined terms, collinear/coplanar, segment vs ray vs line notation
By sides (scalene/isosceles/equilateral), by angles (acute/right/obtuse), dual classification
Sum=180°, algebraic missing angles, isosceles base angle theorem
Exterior = sum of remote interiors, connection to angle sum theorem
Sum of two shortest > longest, range |a-b| < x < a+b

assessmentProblems.question: Name three collinear points from the figure: Points A, B, and C lie on line m. Point D is not on line m.
assessmentProblems.answer: A, B, C are collinear (they all lie on line m). D is not collinear with A, B, C.

assessmentProblems.question: Two angles are supplementary. One measures (3x + 15)° and the other measures (2x + 40)°. Find x and both angle measures.
Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. An alternate interior angle pair measures (5x - 10)° and (3x + 14)°. Find x and the angle measures.
A triangle has two congruent sides and one angle measuring 90°. Classify it using dual classification.
assessmentProblems.answer: Right isosceles triangle (one 90° angle, two equal sides).

assessmentProblems.question: In triangle PQR, angle P = 58° and angle Q = 47°. Find angle R.
An exterior angle of a triangle measures 125°. One remote interior angle is 65°. Find the other remote interior angle.
assessmentProblems.answer: Ext = sum of remotes: 125 = 65 + x → x = 60°.

assessmentProblems.question: Can sides of length 4, 6, and 11 form a triangle? Explain.
assessmentProblems.answer: No. 4 + 6 = 10, and 10 < 11. The sum of the two shortest sides does not exceed the longest, so these cannot form a triangle.

assessmentProblems.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. Same-side interior angles measure (4x + 5)° and (6x - 15)°. Find x and both angle measures.
The angles of a triangle are (3x)°, (5x - 20)°, and (2x + 10)°. Find all three angle measures and classify the triangle.

answerKeys.q1-1: A, B, C (collinear on line m).
